intro: Robiquetia ilocosnortensis, commonly known as the Ilocos Norte bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to humid, subtropical climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
